isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - INSTALL - AUXILIARY SECTION TO MAIN CASE

step1.para: Tighten the middle bolt on each countershaft strap until the countershafts are snug. Shift the reduction sliding clutch into reduction. Attach a chain hoist to the output shaft.

note.para: The front box sliding clutches must be in the neutral position.

step1.para: With the transmission set in the vertical position, block under the clutch housing to prevent damage to the input shaft and position the new gasket on the transmission case ( Figure 276). Lower the auxiliary assembly on the front case rear.

figure.caption: Figure 276. Set Transmission in Vertical Position

note.para: Shift the deep reduction sliding clutch into deep reduction before installing the auxiliary.

step1.para: Install the retaining bolts in the auxiliary housing flange and tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m) ( Figure 277).

figure.caption: Figure 277. Install Retaining Bolts in Auxiliary Housing Flange

step1.para: Make sure a 0.100 countershaft rear bearing shim is installed ( Figure 279). Be sure the countershaft rear bearing races are seated in the bearing bores.

figure.caption: Figure 279. Install Countershaft Rear Bearing Shim

step1.para: Install the two countershaft rear bearing covers and two rear bearing bolts in each cover ( Figure 280). The bolts must be located directly across from each other as shown. Tighten the bolts to 7 in-lbs. (0.8 N·m). DO NOT INSTALL THE COUNTERSHAFT REAR BEARING COVER GASKET.

figure.caption: Figure 280. Install Countershaft Rear Bearing Covers

step1.para: Rotate the output shaft six times in the clockwise direction, then six times counterclockwise to seat the countershaft rear bearings. Use a feeler gauge, as close to one bolt location as possible, and measure the gap between the countershaft rear bearing cover and the auxiliary case ( Figure 281). Record the measurement.

figure.caption: Figure 281. Measure Gap Between Countershaft Rear Bearing Cover and Auxiliary Case

step1.para:
Now measure the gap as close to the other bolt location and record the measurement ( Figure 282). Average the two measurements. Using the average measurement, refer to the Shimming Chart
. Select the numbers in the left column that compare to the average measurement recorded from the countershaft rear bearing cover. Follow the column to the right to identify the proper shim to be used in the countershaft shim bores. Duplicate this procedure for the other countershaft rear bearing cover.

figure.caption: Figure 282. Measure Gap Close to Other Bolt Location

step1.para: Remove the countershaft rear bearing covers and gauging shims ( Figure 283).

figure.caption: Figure 283. Remove Countershaft Rear Bearing Covers and Gauging Shims

step1.para: Position new gaskets on the countershaft rear bearing cover mounting surface and install both rear bearing covers ( Figure 284). Install and tighten the bolts to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m).
